text.p: True or False: If [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is a [mathjaxinline]4\times 4[/mathjaxinline] matrix, and the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = e_1[/mathjaxinline] has exactly one solution, then [mathjaxinline]Ax = e_4[/mathjaxinline] must have at least one solution.

font.p: If [mathjaxinline]Ax = e_1[/mathjaxinline] has exactly one solution, then [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] must be invertible by the Invertible Matrix Theorem. Therefore [mathjaxinline]Ax = v[/mathjaxinline] has a (unique) solution for every [mathjaxinline]v \in \mathbb R^4[/mathjaxinline].
